conclusion: Problem involves shadows cast by four objects labeled A, B, C, and D.
Need to determine how shadows change in position and size as light source moves backward.
Light source is above objects and moving backward.
Shadows are directly below objects when light source is directly above.
Shadows shift position as light source moves away.
Objects labeled A, B, C, and D each cast a shadow.
Light source is above and moving backward.
Shadows change in position and size as light source moves backward.
Shadows are formed when an object blocks light.
Position of shadow depends on light source position relative to object.
Size of shadow depends on distance between light source and object, and object and surface.
If light source moves farther from object, shadow becomes smaller.
If light source moves closer to object, shadow becomes larger.
Direction of shadow changes based on direction of light source.
Light source is currently above objects and moving backward.
Moving backward means light source is moving away from objects.
Light source is getting farther from objects.
Shadows should shift toward direction light source is moving away from.
If light source moves backward, shadows should move forward relative to current positions.
If light source moves away from objects, shadows should move away from objects.
